data.title: Jordan Lacey - 2024 - Football
data.meta_description:
Jordan Lacey (42) Defensive Line  - Career Statistics

Career
Games: 32
Maryville Debut: March 27, 2021, vs. Brevard
Stats Through End of 2023: 61 tackles,
data.text:
Career Statistics

Career

Games: 32

Maryville Debut: March 27, 2021, vs. Brevard

Stats Through End of 2023: 61 tackles, including 30 solo; 9½ tackles-for-loss for minus-33 yards; 4 sacks for minus-18 yards; 1 fumble recovery; 1 pass breakup; 3 quarterback hurries; 1 kickoff return.

2023 (Senior)

Games: 10

Position: DL

Stats: 18 tackles, including seven solo ... 4 tackles-for-loss for minus-10 yards ... 1½ sacks for minus-2 yards ... 1 pass breakup; 1 quarterback hurry.

Best Games: Season-high four tackles included 1-yard sack in 28-8 opening victory at Sewanee ... Closed season with 2-yard tackle-for-loss among three tackles in 48-10 triumph over Southern Virginia ... 5-yard TFL in 35-7 win against Greensboro ... One pass breakup against Centre and one quarterback hurry at Brevard ... Shared sack for minus-1 yard in 49-14 victory at North Carolina Wesleyan.

2022 (Junior)

Games: 10

Position: DL

Stats: 26 tackles, including 16 solo ... 3½ tackles-for-loss for minus-14 yards ... 1 sack for minus-8 yards ... 1 fumble recovery ... 2 quarterback hurries.

Best Games: Career-high six tackles against Brevard ... Included one TFL for 4-yard loss ... Five tackles at Southern Virginia to support 45-7 victory ... 8-yard sack part of strong defensive effort in 56-17 victory at LaGrange ... Three solo tackles against Huntingdon, Brevard and Belhaven ... Four total stops against Huntingdon and three apiece against Shenandoah and Belhaven ... Quarterback hurries in back-to-back games to open season against Berry and Centre ... Also posted first collegiate fumble recovery against Berry ... Solo TFL at Greensboro for minus-1 yard.

2021 (Sophomore)

Games: 10

Position: LB

Stats: 13 tackles, including seven solo … 1½ tackles-for-loss for minus-6 yards … One sack for minus-6 yards … One kickoff return.

Best Games: Season-high four tackles (two solo) in Maryville’s 31-26 win at North Carolina Wesleyan … Multiple tackles against Centre, LaGrange and Greensboro.
